contentrichtext.text: [[File:Jonas Staugaitis.jpg|thumb|Jonas Staugaitis.]] '''Jonas Staugaitis''' ({{Pronunciation|Jonas Staugaitis.ogg}}; May 20, 1868 in Omentiškiai, [[Vilkaviškis district municipality]] – January 18, 1952 in [[Kaunas]]) was the acting [[President of Lithuania]] during the [[1926 Lithuanian coup d'état|December 1926 coup d'état]].<ref>{{Lt icon}} {{Cite web|title=Jonas Staugaitis|publisher=[[Seimas]] (Parliament) of Lithuania|accessdate=2009-10-17|url=http://www3.seimas.lt/pls/inter/w5_show?p_r=4160&p_d=44694&p_k=1}}</ref> He was formally elected for few hours as the Speaker of [[Seimas]]; as the highest-ranked official, he became ''de jure'' the President of Lithuania. He renounced the office after the coup d'état was complete. He was a doctor, having studied at the [[Warsaw University]]. In 1919, he was elected to Lithuanian parliament (Seimas) as a member of the [[Peasant Populist Party]]. On June 2, 1926, he was elected the head of [[Seimas]]. He is buried in [[Petrašiūnai cemetery]] in [[Kaunas]]. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Start box}} {{Succession box |before = [[Kazys Grinius]] |title = [[President of Lithuania]] |years = 18 December 1926 – 19 December 1926 |after = [[Aleksandras Stulginskis]] }} {{End box}} {{Leaders of Lithuania since 1919}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Staugaitis, Jonas | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = President of Lithuania | DATE OF BIRTH = May 20, 1868 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = January 18, 1952 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Staugaitis, Jonas}} [[Category:1868 births]] [[Category:1952 deaths]] [[Category:People from Marijampolė County]] [[Category:Presidents of Lithuania]] [[Category:Speakers of the Seimas]] [[Category:Lithuanian physicians]] {{Lithuania-politician-stub}}
